bib.title: Hybrid linkage learning for permutation optimization with Gene-pool optimal mixing evolutionary algorithms
bib.author: Przewozniczek, Michal W and Komarnicki, Marcin M and Bosman, Peter AN and Thierens, Dirk and Frej, Bartosz and Luong, Ngoc Hoang
bib.abstract: Linkage learning techniques are employed to discover dependencies between problem variables. This knowledge can then be leveraged in an Evolutionary Algorithm (EA) to improve the optimization process. Of particular interest is the Gene-pool Optimal Mixing Evolutionary Algorithm (GOMEA) family, which has been shown to exploit linkage effectively. Recently, Empirical Linkage Learning (ELL) techniques were proposed for binary-encoded problems. While these techniques are computationally expensive, they have the benefit of
bib.booktitle: Proceedings of the Genetic and Evolutionary Computation Conference Companion
